meanings.sent1: I need to retally the coins in my piggy bank to make sure I have enough for a new toy.
meanings.sent2: She decided to retally the votes to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: After losing track, I had to retally the steps to find my way back home.

meanings.definition: To add up a series of numbers again.
meanings.sent1: Let me retally the grocery bill to make sure we have enough money.
meanings.sent2: The accountant had to retally the expenses for the month.
meanings.sent3: I had to retally the points in the game after realizing I made a mistake.
meanings.sent4: The teacher asked the student to retally the scores on the quiz.
meanings.sent5: I retally the ingredients in the recipe to double-check before baking.

meanings.definition: To recount or reassess a total.
meanings.sent1: I will retally the number of books on the shelf to see if any are missing.
meanings.sent2: The auditor had to retally the company's profits for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: I had to retally the number of guests invited to the party.
meanings.sent4: The scientist needed to retally the data to confirm the results.
meanings.sent5: I retally the steps in my mind before taking a leap of faith.
